plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: Oleander is an evergreen shrub known for its long-lasting and fragrant clusters of flowers. It thrives in warm climates and blooms almost year-round in Mediterranean and subtropical regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to December (sometimes longer in warm climates)
plants.funFact: Although toxic if ingested, oleander has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties in controlled doses.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A popular ornamental shrub with glossy evergreen leaves and large, showy flowers. Camellias are winter bloomers, often flowering from late fall through early spring.
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, Korea, China), cultivated in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica was named after botanist Georg Kamel, and its leaves are related to tea plants (Camellia sinensis).

plants.name: Clivia miniata
plants.description: A shade-loving perennial with strap-shaped leaves and clusters of trumpet-shaped flowers. Native to South Africa, it blooms in late winter to early spring but can flower in mild winters in other climates.
plants.funFact: Clivia species are named after the Duchess of Northumberland, Lady Clive, who first received seeds from South Africa.

plants.name: Eucalyptus pauciflora
plants.description: A hardy Australian tree that often flowers in winter, producing clusters of white flowers that attract many nectar-feeding birds and insects.
plants.location: Alpine and subalpine regions of southeastern Australia
plants.funFact: Snow gums are adapted to survive frost and snow, making their winter blooming somewhat unusual among trees.
